pageContext.content:
This is a gallery of all original watercolour, oil and acrylic paintings and limited edition prints available to purchase.

All UK orders receive free postage and packaging. Original paintings are sent via Special Delivery and prints via Standard Delivery. For international and other postage information click here. All paintings and prints are supplied mounted.

paintings.description:
Original watercolour, image size 14"x10".

Mounted to fit 20"x16" frame.

£245

A signed, embossed print is available £45

paintings.description:
A painting to celebrate the Three Choirs Festival, held annually at one of the three Cathedrals. This print has been restricted to 65 copies, image size of 16" x 12".

Original watercolour, image size 16" x 12".

(Original Watercolour SOLD)

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.

paintings.paypalEmbedCode: P693 The River Wye & Cherry Hill
paintings.title: The River Wye and Cherry Hill near Fownhope, Herefordshire

paintings.description:
Originally the home of the Scudamores. Of Norman descent, they settled here in the 14th century. It was rebuilt about 300 years ago and, after the death of Frances Scudamore in 1820, it became a hospital. It is now used as a leisure complex.

Original watercolour, image size 15.5" x 9.5".

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.

image.altText: Holme Lacy House, Holme Lacy, Herefordshire (Watercolour Painting)
image.title: Holme Lacy House, Holme Lacy, Herefordshire

paintings.metaDescription: Originally the home of the Scudamores. Of Norman descent, they settled here in the 14th century. It was rebuilt about 300 years ago and, after the death of Frances Scudamore in 1820, it became a hospital. It is now used as a leisure complex. Original watercolour, image size 15.5" x 9.5". A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
paintings.paypalEmbedCode: P687 Holm Lacy House
paintings.title: Holme Lacy House, Holme Lacy, Herefordshire

paintings.description:
A public house with character and a view south towards the river, a victim of modernisations, pulled down to make way for luxury flats.

Original watercolour, image size 9" x 5.75".

(Original Watercolour SOLD)

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.

image.title: The Antelope Inn, Barton Road, Hereford

paintings.metaDescription: A public house with character and a view south towards the river, a victim of modernisations, pulled down to make way for luxury flats. Original watercolour, image size 9" x 5.75". (Original Watercolour SOLD) A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
paintings.paypalEmbedCode: P685 Antilope Inn
paintings.title: The Antelope Inn, Barton Road, Hereford

paintings.description:
Prosperous village with lime burning kilns and bark production for tanning, the latter being transported along the river on the numerous barges that were operating out of Fownhope.

Original watercolour, image size 9" x 5.75".

Mounted to fit frame size 16" x 12".

Price £195

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
paintings.metaDescription: Prosperous village with lime burning kilns and bark production for tanning, the latter being transported along the river on the numerous barges that were operating out of Fownhope. Original watercolour, image size 9" x 5.75". Mounted to fit frame size 16" x 12". Price £195 A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
paintings.paypalEmbedCode: P684 Old Fownhope,
paintings.title: Old Fownhope, Herefordshire

paintings.description:
Inspiration for this painting came from an old sepia photograph, the thatched cottages on the left known as the "The Hovels" are long gone. The one at the end was pulled down to enable the road to be widened. What a waste, as the road was never altered.

Original watercolour, image size 10" x 5.75".

(Original Watercolour SOLD)

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
paintings.metaDescription: Inspiration for this painting came from an old sepia photograph, the thatched cottages on the left known as the "The Hovels" are long gone. The one at the end was pulled down to enable the road to be widened. What a waste, as the road was never altered. Original watercolour, image size 10" x 5.75". (Original Watercolour SOLD) A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.

paintings.paypalEmbedCode: P678 Old House, Hereford
paintings.title: The Old House, High town, Hereford

paintings.description:
In 1485 it was known as "The Naked Boy". During the civil war, in 1645 the Roundhead colonel, John Birch stayed there after the siege of Goodrich Castle before moving on to capture Hereford. There is a mural in The Naked Boy Restaurant of Tom Spring, Prize Fighter of all England, (1823-1824). One of his fights lasted for over three hours and went on for 77 rounds.

Original watercolour, image size 12" x 7.75".

(Original Watercolour SOLD)

A signed, embossed limited edition print is available £45.
